raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "Autoimmune endocrinopathy", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "This is a classic presentation of IPEX syndrome (Immunodysregulation, Polyendocrinopathy, Enteropathy, X-linked) caused by FOXP3 gene mutation. FOXP3 is essential for regulatory T cell development and function. The triad includes: early-onset enteropathy (watery diarrhea), dermatitis (eczema), and autoimmune endocrinopathies (most commonly type 1 diabetes and thyroiditis). The failure to thrive, age of onset, and regulatory T cell defect all support this diagnosis. Autoimmune endocrinopathy is a hallmark feature of IPEX syndrome. The other options represent different immunodeficiency syndromes: hemorrhagic diathesis (Wiskott-Aldrich), ocular telangiectasias (ataxia-telangiectasia), and retained primary teeth (hyper-IgE syndrome).", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
